p: The prevalence of syndemic conditions within the study cohort is described in Table 2. Over half of participants (53.8%, 100/186) screened positive for depression on the CES-D. Harmful alcohol use and problematic drug use were also common, with 34.4% (64/186) screening positive on the AUDIT and 30.1% (56/186) on the DUDIT. Sexual compulsivity was seen in 16.1% (30/186) of respondents. At least one syndemic condition was present in 74.2% (138/186) of the sample and 46.8% (87/186) had more than one. The median syndemic count was 1 (0, 2).
